Description: Body sherd of Milesian Fikellura pottery neck-amphora; exterior: white slip; on left, leg of tripod (or dinos stand); in centre, bud on long brown stalk; at right, leg of komast and possibly part of his hand, cavorting to right; below, dividing band consisting of band of gear pattern between brown lines; below, trace of band of crescents.
Curator's comments: Schaus lists the sherd as probably belonging to the Altenburg Painter. According to Cook's classification system, the sherd belongs in Division I (with komos scene) of the Altenburg Group.
Bibliographic references: CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (p. 10, no. 15, pl. 9, no. 15) (Incorrectly labelled 86.4-1.1149)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 246, no. 7)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.036)
